title: Drawing, A Winged Victory Riding a Chariot; A Winged Victory Crowning Minerva; two roundels, ca. 1805
title_raw: A Winged Victory Riding a Chariot; A Winged Victory Crowning Minerva; two roundels
medium: Pen and black ink, graphite on paper
markings: On verso, in black ink: Cooper Union stamp: MUSEUM / FOR THE / ARTS OF / DECORATION / COOPER UNION (Lugt 457c); watermark: F C M
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Top: a victory riding toward left. A rostral column is shown in the background. Bottom: a flying female genius crowning Athena seated in her study. Captions: fame della guerre; Felsina. Felsina is a word symbolizing Bologna, in Etruscan.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, A Winged Victory Riding a Chariot; A Winged Victory Crowning Minerva; two roundels, ca. 1805. Pen and black ink, graphite on paper. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3299.
